name: MultiplyImages
author: Nipype (interface)
description:
MultiplyImages, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.ants, interface: MultiplyImages).


    Examples
    --------
    >>> from nipype.interfaces.ants import MultiplyImages
    >>> test = MultiplyImages()
    >>> test.inputs.dimension = 3
    >>> test.inputs.first_input = 'moving2.nii'
    >>> test.inputs.second_input = 0.25
    >>> test.inputs.output_product_image = "out.nii"
    >>> test.cmdline
    'MultiplyImages 3 moving2.nii 0.25 out.nii'

inputs.name: Args
inputs.description: A string. Additional parameters to the command.

inputs.name: Environ
inputs.description: A dictionary with keys which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str' and with values which are a bytes or none or a value of class 'str'. Environment variables.

inputs.name: First input
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Image 1.

inputs.name: Num threads
inputs.description: An integer. Number of itk threads to use.

inputs.name: Output product image
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing a file. Outputfname.nii.gz: the name of the resulting image.

inputs.name: Second input
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file or a float. Image 2 or multiplication weight.

inputs.name: Second input
inputs.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file or a float. Image 2 or multiplication weight.

output-files.name: Output product image
output-files.description: A pathlike object or string representing an existing file. Average image file.
